turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: hi

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: How are you? Where are you from?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I'm good. I'm in Florida. what about you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I'm up in Seattle. I injured myself, so I have some time off from work and I'm giving MTurk a try, what about you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I have family in Washington. I've always wanted to visit the west coast. I've been turking a few years actually. I've decided to go back to college now that my kids are in school and it lets me work around my schedule

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: You should. It's great up here when it's not wild fire season and the smoke blankets everything. How old are you kids?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: They are out on Whidbey Island. The photos on facebook look beautiful. They are 9 and 5. Do you have any kids?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: My girlfriend and I went up there for a date weekend one time. Very nice little community. We don't have any kids, but she wants some. Right now I just do charity to help support families in need. I recently climbed a peak out here called Mount Olympus and raised $600 to go to the childrens hospital.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That is really awesome. I definitely should volunteer more

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Have you heard of Save the children?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: no I haven't. what is that for

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: They're a world wide organization that helps childrens and families in need -  URL -- They help ensure childrens right to health, education, safety etc.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That sounds like a very worthwhile charity.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yeah, the cool thing about them is they partner with MTurk, so you can donate some or all of your payment.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I've seen a lot of HITs that work with charities. It is great to give people the easy option

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yeah, I don't mind donating a few cents or small percentage. I mean I'm sitting comfy at home. Even though I'm not working and I owe medical bills for my injury, there's still a ton of people out there, especially children that need help and can't get it. I'm going to donate some for this one. Do you want to as well?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I usually don't because since I have become a single mom it's been hard to make ends meet and I feel slightly guilty making donations while I am getting assistance myself

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's rough. I totally feel you there. I'm on short-term disability and receiving money from the union, insurance, and people from the jobsite. The way I look at it is I am not donating that assistance, I'm donating my time. If I earn a buck for a turk for a minute, and I donate a few cents, then I'm not using the money people gave me, just my free time.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That is a good way to look at it. I struggle to view it as my free time lol. It's my only income right now while in school. Living off loans and assistance except the rare occassion i get child support. how much are you donating?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yeah, I've done the unemployment worker retraining thing while in school, and I've got no income right now since I work construction. I recently went out to see a movie with a friend and bought a book on sale and felt guilty that people at the job donated their money to help pay my bills, but I'm not abusing it. This turk is what, 2 bucks? I'll probably do a quarter or something. It's an easy turk to pass time and I still get something out of it.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: sounds like a fair enough donation. i'll do the same

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I might do abit more. How much do you want to donate? It'll be directly deducted from your task and can do 0 - $2.
